title: [Large-Scale] Experimental Economics-Based Learning Design for Mitigating Virtual Bias

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic statistics and economics concepts
context.additional_context: Investigating causes and solutions for hypothetical bias through VR simulations mimicking real economic experiment environments, analyzing learners' decision-making processes with real cases and virtual scenarios

learning_goals: Learners can explain the mechanisms of virtual bias occurrence by applying principles of experimental economics.
Learners can identify response differences between real payment situations and virtual scenarios with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can design strategies to reduce virtual bias by over 50% through a sequential voting system.

resources: Small-scale budget with actual payment capability

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
